intro: Senecio niederleinii, commonly known as the Niederlein's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and linear. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens or as an ornamental plant.
